job_details.Functieomschrijving:
We are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer, with passion for working on cutting edge problems that can help us create highly realistic, emotional and life-like synthetic humans through text-to-video.

   Our aim is to make video content creation available for all - not only to studio production!

        You will be someone who loves to code and build working systems. You are used to working in a fast-paced start-up environment. You will have experience with the software development life cycle, from ideation through implementation, to testing and release.

       You will join a group of more than 40 Engineers in the R&D department and will have the opportunity to collaborate with multiple research teams across diverse areas, our R&D research is guided by our co-founders - Prof. Lourdes Agapito and Prof. Matthias Niessner.

   If you know and love Voicebox, Whisper, VALL-E, SPEAR-TTS and more - and you love machine learning and large data, then we would love to talk to you. We will also want to talk to you - if that's what you dream of doing.  

What will you be doing?

     In this position, you'll join the team to help develop our LLM-based TTS system that will provide our customers with voice clones that are indistinguishable from real voices. You will also help us create high quality, production ready code and take ownership of production pipelines. This would include:
     * Creating new or refining existing data processing pipelines that will run on very large amounts of data.
     * Taking hypotheses, ideas or papers and creating implementations of solutions on the back of these.
     * Running experiments on the back of the created implementations to evaluate and verify your hypotheses.
     * Work on model training and inference optimisation.
     * Contributing to a high-quality codebase, developing tests where necessary, and participating in code reviews.
     * Helping a team of Research engineers and Scientists to write clean and efficient code, and define best practices.
     * Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment.
     * Developing production quality software, our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world.
     * Optimising for deployment - turning prototypes into working solutions., You will work in a hybrid setting with an office in London
job_details.full_text:
Machine Learning Engineer - Large Models

We are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer, with passion for working on cutting edge problems that can help us create highly realistic, emotional and life-like synthetic humans through text-to-video.

   Our aim is to make video content creation available for all - not only to studio production!

        You will be someone who loves to code and build working systems. You are used to working in a fast-paced start-up environment. You will have experience with the software development life cycle, from ideation through implementation, to testing and release.

       You will join a group of more than 40 Engineers in the R&D department and will have the opportunity to collaborate with multiple research teams across diverse areas, our R&D research is guided by our co-founders - Prof. Lourdes Agapito and Prof. Matthias Niessner.

   If you know and love Voicebox, Whisper, VALL-E, SPEAR-TTS and more - and you love machine learning and large data, then we would love to talk to you. We will also want to talk to you - if that's what you dream of doing.  

What will you be doing?

     In this position, you'll join the team to help develop our LLM-based TTS system that will provide our customers with voice clones that are indistinguishable from real voices. You will also help us create high quality, production ready code and take ownership of production pipelines. This would include:
     * Creating new or refining existing data processing pipelines that will run on very large amounts of data.
     * Taking hypotheses, ideas or papers and creating implementations of solutions on the back of these.
     * Running experiments on the back of the created implementations to evaluate and verify your hypotheses.
     * Work on model training and inference optimisation.
     * Contributing to a high-quality codebase, developing tests where necessary, and participating in code reviews.
     * Helping a team of Research engineers and Scientists to write clean and efficient code, and define best practices.
     * Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment.
     * Developing production quality software, our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world.
     * Optimising for deployment - turning prototypes into working solutions., You will work in a hybrid setting with an office in London

profile_classification.rationale: The job description emphasizes developing LLM-based TTS systems, creating voice clones, and working with large models for text-to-video synthesis. It highlights core responsibilities such as prompt engineering (implied through TTS and voice cloning), building RAG systems (implied through data processing pipelines for large datasets), and developing production-grade software. The technologies mentioned (Voicebox, Whisper, VALL-E, SPEAR-TTS) are all related to generative AI, specifically in speech and video. While ML Engineer is mentioned, the focus on generative models and user-facing applications aligns more closely with the GenAI Engineer profile.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Creating new or refining existing data processing pipelines that will run on very large amounts of data' directly relates to the design, building, and maintenance of data pipelines for large datasets.
job_tasks.phrase: Creating new or refining existing data processing pipelines that will run on very large amounts of data

job_tasks.justification: The description mentions 'develop our LLM-based TTS system', 'work on model training and inference optimisation', and 'Taking hypotheses, ideas or papers and creating implementations of solutions on the back of these', which are all core activities in creating, training, and adapting generative models.
The phrase 'Running experiments on the back of the created implementations to evaluate and verify your hypotheses' is a key part of the model development and evaluation process.
job_tasks.phrase: Running experiments on the back of the created implementations to evaluate and verify your hypotheses

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Work on model training and inference optimisation' directly refers to the process of training and optimizing machine learning models.
job_tasks.phrase: Work on model training and inference optimisation

job_tasks.justification: The job requires 'creating high quality, production ready code', 'contributing to a high-quality codebase, developing tests where necessary, and participating in code reviews', and 'Developing production quality software, our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world.' This indicates a strong focus on building and deploying user-facing software systems.
job_tasks.phrase: Creating high quality, production ready code

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Developing production quality software, our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world.' highlights the development of robust, production-ready software for end-users.
job_tasks.phrase: Developing production quality software, our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Optimising for deployment - turning prototypes into working solutions.' describes the process of taking developed models or features and making them functional and deployable as part of a larger system.
job_tasks.phrase: Optimising for deployment - turning prototypes into working solutions.

job_tasks.justification: The mention of 'take ownership of production pipelines' and 'Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment' directly aligns with the responsibilities of MLOps, managing the end-to-end lifecycle of models in production.

The phrase 'Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment' encompasses the entire process of bringing a model from ideation to production and maintenance.
job_tasks.phrase: Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment
